764905924376920065.text: Historia ya Zanzibar,CCM na ile ya Muungano wetu haziwezi kukamilika bila kumtaja Marehemu Aboud Jumbe Mwinyi. Apumzike Mahala Pema, Peponi

764905572521041920.text: Nimestushwa na kusikitishwa sana na taarifa za kifo cha Marehemu Mhe Aboud Jumbe Mwinyi. Naungana na Watanzania wote kuomboleza msiba huu.

764796488954150913.text: My Chairmanship of the Commonwealth Obsever Mission for Zambian Election was made much easier by this great team. https://t.co/Skh0cxKnDh

764427532439519232.text: The Commonwealth urge all political parties and candidates in Zambia to respect the will of the people of Zambia

764427427527462912.text: Zambia has a history of upholding democratic values during elections. We urge all stakeholders to cherish this history.

764427380739960832.text: We noted, where there were anomalies, they were not of such gravity as to negatively impact the credibility of the process.

764427345776218112.text: We appeal to all Zambians to refrain from making any utterances and  acts that could trigger tensions and affect post election enviroment

764427299756343296.text: Urge all parties and candidates in Zambia to seek redress for any grievances through peaceful dialogue and through prescribed legal channels

764427207557189632.text: It is our hope and expactation that the spirit of orderliness,tolerance and peace, which has characterized the voting process will prevail

764427135658385409.text: Mindful that results process is ongoing, our final assessment on the entire process will be contained in our final report @commonwealthsec

764427099071545344.text: Our overall conclusion is that the voting,closing and counting process at the polling stations were credible and transparent.

764426061769760768.text: Challenges obseved, inadequate education on the referendum, queue managenent and late opening of the few polling stations

764425613147070464.text: We have witnessed an encouraging turn-out,a largely peaceful process, a robust voter register and non intrusive presence of police

764424797174525954.text: Most voting stations opened on time with few exceptions. We were strucked by very long queues in some polling stations.

764424315571929088.text: It is view of stakeholders that media in Zambia is polarised. Both public and private media have in some cases reported events innacurately

744934770266734592.text: Way forward  Panel recommends calling of High Level Summit on Global Public Health Crises in 2018.

744934576133378048.text: Way forward Panel recommends the establishment of a High-Level Council on Global Public Health Crises

744934034128670720.text: Without a dramatic attitudinal change in the global health architecture,the world may be in a similar or even worse situation in next crisis

744933705840533504.text: Panel has recommended the establishment of a fund of at least US$1 billion for research and development on priority communicable diseases

744933450252193792.text: The Ebola outbreak was difficult to control causing many deaths as a result, because there was no vaccine nor medicine.

744933221360599040.text: The WHO Contingency Fund to be increased to $300 million instead of the proposed $100 million by Member States based on assessed scale.

744933027567001600.text: Panel proposes 10% of voluntary contributions to the WHO to be directed to building operational capacity.

744932900878041088.text: To ensure finances for WHO,Panel proposes Member states statutory contribution be increased by 10 percent to be dedicated for this purpose

744932558010486784.text: The Panel, further proposes that the Centre should have own Advisory Board to give it the necessary levels of operational autonomy.

744932445913497600.text: Panel welcomes the decision taken by the Director General of WHO to establish a Centre for Emergency Preparedness and Response.

744932349247356928.text: If WHO is to perform emergence and operational functions,i t must be reformed and credible operational and emergence capacity be built.

744932124982128640.text: The Panel is convinced, that there is no substitute to the World Health Organization as the single global leader on health matters.

744931873030344709.text: WHO relies on voluntary contributions by countries,  orgzs and persons of good will to undertake and underwrite the response.

744931582151172096.text: WHO doesnt have the financial,technical and human resources to undertake& coordinate a strong response on its own during major outbreak.

744931039819214848.text: The WHO lacks operational capacity and the little that there was has been almost crippled by lack of funding.

744931011067318273.text: WHO could not live up to expectation it is more of a normative institution and not an operational one.

744921041248653312.text: Panel is proposing a joint meeting between WHO and the WTO to discuss ways to adress airline responces to future health crises

744920238819508225.text: It was not wise for the WHO to delay declaration of a PHEIC. In future, the WHO should go ahead and do what is the right

744919749583380480.text: Panel recommends in future outbreaks, the WHO should not wait until many people have died to cause a credible response to be mounted.

744919546142793728.text: The outbreak was first reported Dec 2013 whereas the PHEIC was declared in Aug, 2014.

744919524407906304.text: The WHO was slow in declaring a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (Pheic)

744919148426366976.text: Global response was too slow and inadequate for the Ebola outbreak in West Africa. Many lives were lost because of that.

744918891911122944.text: Panel recommends regional orgz build response capacities ready to be deployed in the event of a health crisis within their regions.

744918277810438144.text: The deployment of medical professionals and the mobilisation of govts and the private sector to contribute resources were  good examples

744917910129418241.text: Panel was impressed with the contributions of both the @_AfricanUnion  and the ECOWAS in the fight against Ebola.

744917584345243648.text: Smooth functioning of coordination structures, understanding of the cultures and respect thereof are critical elements of the response.

744917220959076352.text: Panel advise in future outbreaks & responses, governance and effective community engagement by the responders should be given high priority.

744916747178881024.text: governance as well as knowledge of the disease and the culture of the local communities were critical for the success of the response.

744916370408767488.text: Out of $ 30 billion spent annually by donors, bulk goes to disease control and eradication programmes and not strengthening health systems

744915771747340289.text: Panel recommends donor countries give serious consideration to supporting developing countries to build IHR core capacities & health systems

744915483678380032.text: Ways must be found to ensure that all countries are fully IHR  compliant by 2020.

744915242715615232.text: Sadly, though a binding obligation only 65 out of 196 State Parties to IHR have met the minimum core capacities standards

744915026318852096.text: The Panel learnt that most WHO member states are not compliant with the requirements of the International Health Regulations (IHR).

744914768784429056.text: In 2013, for example, Guinea had 1 doctor per 10,000 people, Liberia and Sierra Leone had 0.2 and 0.1. The  WHO standard is 23 per 10,000.

744914336783732736.text: The Panel learnt that in many developing nations health systems are weak,they make these countries vulnerable to outbreaks of diseases.

744914048563707904.text: If deficiencies are not addressed, in the outbreak of any other pandemic in the developing world the consequences would be even more severe.

744914034588270592.text: The Ebola crisis laid bare the serious weaknesses or inadequacy of the international health architecture at the national,regional and global

744914022013730816.text: Tourism  suffered much through cancellation of bookings for the so called fear of Ebola in  the whole of African continent.

744914008575205376.text: Even African countries that were very far away from the three countries were adversely affected by Ebola crisis

744913996952788992.text: As a result of Ebola crisis, World Bank estimates a $ 2.2 billion loss to GDP of the three countries Liberia,Guinea and Sierra Leone

744913978141380613.text: The Panel learnt a lot the challenges faced during the Ebola crisis and about the national, regional and international efforts and responses

744910982636515328.text: Will share the Key Findings and Recommendations of the Panel I chaired on Global Responce to Health Crises from Dakar via video conference

744910410441199616.text: I thanks @UN_PGA for invitation to participate on the Briefing on the Implementation of the Recommendations of the Panel on Health Crisis
